001package beginner;
002
003import com.sandwich.koan.Koan;
004
005import java.text.MessageFormat;
006import java.util.IllegalFormatException;
007import java.util.MissingFormatArgumentException;
008
009import static com.sandwich.koan.constant.KoanConstants.__;
010import static com.sandwich.util.Assert.assertEquals;
011import static com.sandwich.util.Assert.fail;
012
013public class AboutStrings {
014
015    @Koan
016    public void implicitStrings() {
017        assertEquals("just a plain ole string".getClass(), String.class);
018    }
019
020    @Koan
021    public void newString() {
022        // very rarely if ever should Strings be created via new String() in
023        // practice - generally it is redundant, and done repetitively can be slow
024        String string = new String();
025        String empty = "";
026        assertEquals(string.equals(empty), true);
027    }
028
029    @Koan
030    public void newStringIsRedundant() {
031        String stringInstance = "zero";
032        String stringReference = new String(stringInstance);
033        assertEquals(stringInstance.equals(stringReference), true);
034    }
035
036    @Koan
037    public void newStringIsNotIdentical() {
038        String stringInstance = "zero";
039        String stringReference = new String(stringInstance);
040        assertEquals(stringInstance == stringReference, false);
041    }
042
043    @Koan
044    public void stringIsEmpty() {
045        assertEquals("".isEmpty(), true);
046        assertEquals("one".isEmpty(), false);
047        assertEquals(new String().isEmpty(), true);
048        assertEquals(new String("").isEmpty(), true);
049        assertEquals(new String("one").isEmpty(), false);
050    }
051
052    @Koan
053    public void stringLength() {
054        assertEquals("".length(), 0);
055        assertEquals("one".length(), 3);
056        assertEquals("the number is one".length(), 17);
057    }
058
059    @Koan
060    public void stringTrim() {
061        assertEquals("".trim(), "");
062        assertEquals("one".trim(), "one");
063        assertEquals(" one more time".trim(), "one more time");
064        assertEquals(" one more time         ".trim(), "one more time");
065        assertEquals(" and again\t".trim(), "and again");
066        assertEquals("\t\t\twhat about now?\t".trim(), "what about now?");
067    }
068/*
069    @Koan
070    public void stringConcatenation() {
071        String one = "one";
072        String space = " ";
073        String two = "two";
074        assertEquals(one + space + two, __);
075        assertEquals(space + one + two, __);
076        assertEquals(two + space + one, __);
077    }
078
079    @Koan
080    public void stringUpperCase() {
081        String str = "I am a number one!";
082        assertEquals(str.toUpperCase(), __);
083    }
084
085    @Koan
086    public void stringLowerCase() {
087        String str = "I AM a number ONE!";
088        assertEquals(str.toLowerCase(), __);
089    }
090
091    @Koan
092    public void stringCompare() {
093        String str = "I AM a number ONE!";
094        assertEquals(str.compareTo("I AM a number ONE!") == 0, __);
095        assertEquals(str.compareTo("I am a number one!") == 0, __);
096        assertEquals(str.compareTo("I AM A NUMBER ONE!") == 0, __);
097    }
098
099    @Koan
100    public void stringCompareIgnoreCase() {
101        String str = "I AM a number ONE!";
102        assertEquals(str.compareToIgnoreCase("I AM a number ONE!") == 0, __);
103        assertEquals(str.compareToIgnoreCase("I am a number one!") == 0, __);
104        assertEquals(str.compareToIgnoreCase("I AM A NUMBER ONE!") == 0, __);
105    }
106
107    @Koan
108    public void stringStartsWith() {
109        assertEquals("".startsWith("one"), __);
110        assertEquals("one".startsWith("one"), __);
111        assertEquals("one is the number".startsWith("one"), __);
112        assertEquals("ONE is the number".startsWith("one"), __);
113    }
114
115    @Koan
116    public void stringEndsWith() {
117        assertEquals("".endsWith("one"), __);
118        assertEquals("one".endsWith("one"), __);
119        assertEquals("the number is one".endsWith("one"), __);
120        assertEquals("the number is two".endsWith("one"), __);
121        assertEquals("the number is One".endsWith("one"), __);
122    }
123
124    @Koan
125    public void stringSubstring() {
126        String str = "I AM a number ONE!";
127        assertEquals(str.substring(0), __);
128        assertEquals(str.substring(1), __);
129        assertEquals(str.substring(5), __);
130        assertEquals(str.substring(14, 17), __);
131        assertEquals(str.substring(7, str.length()), __);
132    }
133
134    @Koan
135    public void stringContains() {
136        String str = "I AM a number ONE!";
137        assertEquals(str.contains("one"), __);
138        assertEquals(str.contains("ONE"), __);
139    }
140
141    @Koan
142    public void stringReplace() {
143        String str = "I am a number ONE!";
144        assertEquals(str.replace("ONE", "TWO"), __);
145        assertEquals(str.replace("I am", "She is"),  __);
146    }
147
148    @Koan
149    public void stringBuilderCanActAsAMutableString() {
150        assertEquals(new StringBuilder("one").append(" ").append("two").toString(), __);
151    }
152
153    @Koan
154    public void readableStringFormattingWithStringFormat() {
155        assertEquals(String.format("%s %s %s", "a", "b", "a"), __);
156    }
157
158    @Koan
159    public void extraArgumentsToStringFormatGetIgnored() {
160        assertEquals(String.format("%s %s %s", "a", "b", "c", "d"), __);
161    }
162*/
163    @Koan
164    public void insufficientArgumentsToStringFormatCausesAnError() {
165        try {
166            String.format("%s %s %s", "a", "b");
167            fail("No Exception was thrown!");
168        } catch (Exception e) {
169            assertEquals(e.getClass(), MissingFormatArgumentException.class);
170            assertEquals(e.getMessage(), "Format specifier '%s'");
171        }
172    }
173
174    @Koan
175    public void readableStringFormattingWithMessageFormat() {
176        assertEquals(MessageFormat.format("{0} {1} {0}", "a", "b"), __);
177    }
178
179    @Koan
180    public void extraArgumentsToMessageFormatGetIgnored() {
181        assertEquals(MessageFormat.format("{0} {1} {0}", "a", "b", "c"), __);
182    }
183
184    @Koan
185    public void insufficientArgumentsToMessageFormatDoesNotReplaceTheToken() {
186        assertEquals(MessageFormat.format("{0} {1} {0}", "a"), __);
187    }
188}
